context_bundle.summary: GraphQL schema design with type definitions, resolvers, federation for microservices, and API best practices

common_patterns: Schema: 'type User { id: ID! name: String! email: String! posts: [Post!]! } type Post { id: ID! title: String! author: User! }'
Query: 'type Query { user(id: ID!): User users: [User!]! }'
Mutation: 'type Mutation { createUser(name: String!, email: String!): User! updateUser(id: ID!, name: String): User! }'
Resolver: 'const resolvers = { Query: { user: (parent, { id }, context) => context.db.users.findById(id) } };'
DataLoader: 'const userLoader = new DataLoader(ids => batchGetUsers(ids)); // batch loading'
Federation: '@key(fields: "id") type User @extends { id: ID! @external reviews: [Review!]! }'
Subscriptions: 'type Subscription { postAdded: Post! } // real-time updates'
known_errors: N+1 problem: Use DataLoader for batching, implement field-level caching
over-fetching: Design precise types, use fragments for reusable selections
under-fetching: Add necessary fields to types, use nested resolvers
resolver timeout: Implement timeout logic, optimize database queries
schema stitching issues: Use federation for better composition
authentication: Implement context-based auth, check permissions in resolvers
